spec.name: GMA Format
spec.note: There can be empty entries without data or a name.
Model names are null ('\0') terminated without any alignment.
The model name base position is right after the model/name offset list.
The transformation matrix is a 3 x 4 (row major) matrix of 12 floats
The model header size is aligned to 0x20 bytes
The Model occurs directly after the Model Header
Note mesh headers are determined to be in layer 1 or layer 2 based on when they appear. I there are 4 layer 1 meshes, then the first 4 mesh header will be for layer 1.
Note The Model Type 1 is aligned to 0x20 bytes after the Unknown 8 Type 2s.
Note The number of non-indexed strips isn't written anywhere. You know you're finished once you reach its size and is aligned to 0x20 bytes after.

flag.info: Ok to be left as null
Ok to be left as null if the number of objects is 0/referenced item is not set

entry.info: List Model Entries (one for each model)
Section flags (16Bit: 0x01; Stitching Model: 0x04; Skin Model: 0x08; Effective Model: 0x10)
Transformation matrix defaults indexes (8 separate bytes)
List Transformation Matrices (One for each Transformation Matrix)

section.name: Model Type 1 (Skin Model or Effective Model only)

entry.info: Offet Part Vertex Pool (Relative offset from start of model to after The Mesh Headers ie: where the Vertex Pool starts)
Offet Part Mesh Data (Relative offset from the start of the model to after the Unknown 8 Types ie: where the Mesh Data starts)
List Mesh Headers (One for each mesh header)
List Vertex Pool (One for each vertex)
List Type 8 Unknown 1s (Only for Skin Model, number is (offsetPartType8Unknown2 - offsetPartType8Unknown1)/0x20)
List Type 8 Unknown 2s (Only for Skin Model, number is the max Unknown 18 value in the Type 8 Unknown 1s)
List Mesh Data (One for each mesh (layer 1 + layer 2))

section.name: Model Type 2 (16Bit or Stitching Model only)
